A study by the Congressional Budget Office in November 2002 compared federal General Schedule employee salaries with nonfederal employees, showing that federal employees in certain occupations tended to earn less than their private sector counterparts. The comparison between federal employees in different occupations showed that those in professional and administrative roles tended to earn less than their private sector counterparts, with about 85% lagging behind by more than 20%. In contrast, around 30% of federal employees in technical and clerical positions had salaries higher than those in private firms.
